cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing NNW today, then turning NW and slowing while tracking toward the middle Texas coast before stalling near/just inland of the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast (around Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX; tropical-storm warning northward to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact zone is the central–southern Texas coast; secondary impacts (rain, minor surge, swell) expected along the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along southeast Louisiana coast, but exceedance of 3 ft at New Orleans not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches possible Monday–Wednesday with localized flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands; disruptive swells/rip currents on approaches to the Mississippi River delta
